headline: Pride Month 2022 Celebrates Lgbtq Rights Amid Transgender Controversies
summary: Wednesday marked the beginning ofPride Month, a celebration of the struggle for LGBTQ+ rights.President Joe Bidenformally recognizedPride Month on Tuesday, saying, “This month, we honor the resilience of LGBTQI+ people, who are fighting to live authentically and freely ... And we recommit to delivering protections, safety, and equality to LGBTQI+ families so that everyone can realize the full promise of America.” Biden alsocalled on Congress to pass the Equality Act, which would ban discrimination based on sex, sexual orientation and gender identity in federally funded programs.Apart from a 2019tweetby former President Donald Trump, no Republican president has recognized Pride Month. In 2021, polling byGallup (Center bias)showed that 70% of Americans supported legal same-sex marriage and 69% said “gay or lesbian relations” were morally acceptable. However, 51% said “changing one’s gender” was morally wrong, vs. 46% saying it was morally acceptable.News and opinion coverage of Pride Month was rare in major right-rated outlets on Wednesday. However, severallocal outletspublished op-eds about the celebration. Coverage and voices from the left tended to support acceptance of LGBTQ+ identities and criticizebills passed by Republican state legislators. Some voices from the right criticized what they called “radical gender theory”; onearticleinThe American Conservative (Right bias)used a derogatory term for trans people in its first sentence.
